alert.note: Alert for Eastern Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 8:26AM EST until January 14 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 4 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Snow total accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Eastern Tucker County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon EST today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 4 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Persons are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Please report snow or ice accumulations by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPittsburgh. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
